English: The words of Nehemiah the son of Hachaliah. It came to pass in the month of Chislev, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the citadel
Bahnar: Nơ̆ra Nêhêmi kon drŏ-nglo Hakalia Sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt lăm khei Kisle,b kơplah inh oei lăm pơlei tih Susan.

English: that Hanani one of my brethren came with men from Judah; and I asked them concerning the Jews who had escaped, who had survived the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Hanani minh 'nu bơngai lăm lu 'nhŏng oh inh năm hơdai hăm lu bơngai Juđa, inh apinh lu sư gah lu adrĕch Juđa gơh klaih wă khan bơngai mă đe rôp pơm bơnă boih oei đei păng apinh hloi gah pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And they said to me, “The survivors who are left from the captivity in the province are there in great distress and reproach. The wall of Jerusalem is also broken down, and its gates are burned with fire.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh roi kơ inh thoi âu: Lu bơngai mă đe rôp pơm bơnă oei đei lăm pơlei, đei tơdrong truh păng mơlâu răm dêh, dur pơlei Jêrusalem pơchah răm păng lu 'măng jang sư ŭnh kư̆m sa đĭ boih.

English: So it was, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned for many days; I was fasting and praying before the God of heaven.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r noh, inh hơ-oei na nhơ̆m grong lăm hơdôm năr; inh ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa păng krao khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hơtăl plĕnh thoi âu

English: And I said: “I pray, LORD God of heaven, O great and awesome God, You who keep Your covenant and mercy with those who love You and observe Your commandments
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ hơtăl plĕnh, wă khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tih hloh păng trŏ kơkuh tơ'ngla wei nơ̆r pơgơ̆p păng jơhngơ̆m 'mêm mơnat kơ lu bơngai mă kơkuh 'mêm kơ Sư păng wei răk dôm nơ̆r tơtă đơ̆ng Sư!

English: please let Your ear be attentive and Your eyes open, that You may hear the prayer of Your servant which I pray before You now, day and night, for the children of Israel Your servants, and confess the sins of the children of Israel which we have sinned against You. Both my father’s house and I have sinned.
Bahnar: Inh apinh Ih lăng păng đon Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r krao khan inh bơngai đĭch đam Ih, dang ei inh oei krao khan rim năr rim măng yua kơ adrĕch Isơrael, lu đĭch đam Ih, oei 'bơ̆t anăp Ih păng roi tơbral dôm tơdrong yoch kon pơlei Isơrael mă lu nhôn pơm glăi boih hăm Ih, inh păng hnam dơnŏ 'bok inh kư̆m pơm yoch.

English: We have acted very corruptly against You, and have not kept the commandments, the statutes, nor the ordinances which You commanded Your servant Moses.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn đei pơm yoch kơnê̆ dêh păng Ih, ưh kơ wei răk nơ̆r Ih tơtă păng tơdrong juăt Ih đei bơtho khan boih kơ 'bok Môis, đĭch đam Ih.

English: Remember, I pray, the word that You commanded Your servant Moses, saying, ‘If you are unfaithful, I will scatter you among the nations
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'blŏk bĕ kơ nơ̆r Ih bơtho khan boih kơ 'bok Môis đĭch đam Ih thoi âu: Tơdah lu iĕm pơm yoch, Inh gô tơraih lu iĕm tơ tŏk-bŏk lu adrĕch adrung, kon bơngai.

English: but if you return to Me, and keep My commandments and do them, though some of you were cast out to the farthest part of the heavens, yet I will gather them from there, and bring them to the place which I have chosen as a dwelling for My name.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm wih brŏk tơ Inh, wei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Inh tơtă, mă khan lu iĕm tơklah tơklang jrok oei tôch kơ plĕnh teh, Inh kư̆m gô krao akŭm lu sư brŏk păng inh gô chông anhăk lu sư truh tơ anih Inh mă hơmet lê̆ boih wă kơ Anăn Inh kư̆m oei tơ noh mơ̆n.

English: Now these are Your servants and Your people, whom You have redeemed by Your great power, and by Your strong hand.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu sư jing đĭch đam păng kon pơlei Ih mă Ih yua tơdrong mơsêh ti pran kơtang Ih dŏng pơklaih.

English: O Lord, I pray, please let Your ear be attentive to the prayer of Your servant, and to the prayer of Your servants who desire to fear Your name; and let Your servant prosper this day, I pray, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man.” For I was the king’s cupbearer.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu đĭch đam Ih krao apinh păng krao chă, lu bơngai mă đĭ jơhngơ̆m hli yom kơ Anăn Ih, năr âu apinh Ih tơgŭm ăn gơh đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk păng ăn kơ lu sư gơh đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai âu. Kơplah ei kơnh inh gô pôk glơng kơchŏk tơdrô ăn kơ pơtao.

English: And it came to pass in the month of Nisan, in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, when wine was before him, that I took the wine and gave it to the king. Now I had never been sad in his presence before.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt chăl pơtao Artaserses, khei Nisana đei boih sik hơmu 'bơ̆t anăp sư, inh iŏk pôk pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơtao; inh ưh kơ đei sơ'ngon ôh 'bơ̆t anăp sư.

English: Therefore the king said to me, “Why is your face sad, since you are not sick? This is nothing but sorrow of heart.” So I became dreadfully afraid
Bahnar: Pơtao jet inh: “Liơ muh măt ih sơ'ngon dêh thoi noh, ih huay kơ jĭ bơlŏ ră dah kiơ̆ tơdrong noh ưh kơ hiôk sơ'ngon lăm jơhngơ̆m đĕch, dang ei inh hli dêh

English: and said to the king, “May the king live forever! Why should my face not be sad, when the city, the place of my fathers’ tombs, lies waste, and its gates are burned with fire?”
Bahnar: Na khan: Kơ pơtao hơpơi kơ pơtao arih ling-lang! Liơ mă inh ưh kơ sơ'ngon

English: Then the king said to me, “What do you request?” So I prayed to the God of heaven.
Bahnar: Pơtao jet inh thoi âu: “Ih apinh kiơ?” Inh krao khan apinh hloi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ dôm tăl plĕnh

English: And I said to the king, “If it pleases the king, and if your servant has found favor in your sight, I ask that you send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers’ tombs, that I may rebuild it.”
Bahnar: Na roi kơ pơtao thoi âu: “Tơdah ih 'bôh tơdrong noh 'lơ̆ng, tơdah ih mơnat kơ inh đĭch đam ih, apinh ih wơh inh brŏk tơ char Juđa, tơ pơlei mă đei bơsat lu 'bok inh, wă kơ inh man pơjing pơlei ei dơ̆ng.”

English: Then the king said to me (the queen also sitting beside him), “How long will your journey be? And when will you return?” So it pleased the king to send me; and I set him a time.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei yă pơtao oei ngôi 'bơ̆t cheng pơtao, na pơtao jet inh: “Ih năm đunh dang yơ păng layơ ih brŏk?” Thoi noh pơtao lăp đon wơh inh năm păng inh pơkă măng năr kơ sư.

English: Furthermore I said to the king, “If it pleases the king, let letters be given to me for the governors of the region beyond the River, that they must permit me to pass through till I come to Judah
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m roi kơ pơtao thoi âu: “Tơdah tơdrong âu ih lăp đon, apinh ih pơjao kơ inh hla bơar kơthơ roi kơ lu pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r char pah to đak krong gơh ăn kơ inh yak năm hlôi truh tơ char Juđa

English: and a letter to Asaph the keeper of the king’s forest, that he must give me timber to make beams for the gates of the citadel which pertains to the temple, for the city wall, and for the house that I will occupy.” And the king granted them to me according to the good hand of my God upon me.
Bahnar: kư̆m chih tơjur ăn kơ Asap, bơngai mă wei bri kơdrơ̆ng pơtao, roi ăn kơ sư asong inh 'long wă pơm jrăng 'măng jang ming pơdơ̆ng, dur pơlei gah hnam Kră Yang păng hnam inh oei.” Na pơtao ăn kơ inh dôm tơdrong noh, kiơ̆ thoi tơpang ti 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm inh.

English: Then I went to the governors in the region beyond the River, and gave them the king’s letters. Now the king had sent captains of the army and horsemen with me.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh năm truh tơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r char paih to đak krong, mơ̆t ăn kơ sư kơthơ đơ̆ng pơtao, đơ̆ng noh pơtao wơh lu yŏng linh păng lu linh hao aseh kư̆m năm hơdai inh.

English: When Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite official heard of it, they were deeply disturbed that a man had come to seek the well-being of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah noh Sanhalat bơngai Hôrôn păng Tôbia đĭch đam Ammôn, băt tơdrong noh, na ưh kơ hiôk yua kơ đei bơngai truh wă chă tơgŭm lu kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: So I came to Jerusalem and was there three days.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng oei tơ noh pêng năr.

English: Then I arose in the night, I and a few men with me; I told no one what my God had put in my heart to do at Jerusalem; nor was there any animal with me, except the one on which I rode.
Bahnar: Inh păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ inh, lu nhôn iung yak kơmăng, inh ưh kơ đei roi kơ bu băt ôh tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn lăm jơhngơ̆m inh, tơdrong jang tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, inh hao aseh lu bơngai kiơ̆ inh yak năm jơ̆ng hoh.

English: And I went out by night through the Valley Gate to the Serpent Well and the Refuse Gate, and viewed the walls of Jerusalem which were broken down and its gates which were burned with fire.
Bahnar: Lăm măng noh inh lĕch trong 'măng jang Thŭng, tơklă đak sơlŭng Kŏ bri, truh tơ 'măng jang Râm nhôn chă lăng dur pơlei Jêrusalem pơchah răm păng lu 'măng jang kư̆m đĭ kơ ŭnh sa.

English: Then I went on to the Fountain Gate and to the King’s Pool, but there was no room for the animal under me to pass.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh năm truh tơ 'măng jang Tu đak sơlŭng păng truh tơ đak dơnâu anih pơtao, na aseh inh hao ưh kơ gơh wă yak năm hlôi kơ noh.

English: So I went up in the night by the valley, and viewed the wall; then I turned back and entered by the Valley Gate, and so returned.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh năm rok tơter đak glung, chă lăng dur pơlei đơ̆ng noh lu nhôn brŏk hơlơ̆k tơ rŏng mơ̆t trong 'măng jang Thŭng, kơplah noh 'năr tam mă hơdah.

English: And the officials did not know where I had gone or what I had done; I had not yet told the Jews, the priests, the nobles, the officials, or the others who did the work.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu yŏng pơgơ̆r ưh kơ băt inh năm tơ yơ păng pơm kiơ lăm măng noh, yua kơ inh ưh kơ đei roi kơ bơngai Juđa, dah lu 'bok soi lu yŏng mơng dah lu bơngai pơgơ̆r, mă lu bơngai wă jang kư̆m ưh kơ băt mơ̆n.

English: Then I said to them, “You see the distress that we are in, how Jerusalem lies waste, and its gates are burned with fire. Come and let us build the wall of Jerusalem, that we may no longer be a reproach.”
Bahnar: Na inh khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Lu iĕm athei lăng tơdrong anat anot kơ lu bơ̆n dang ei; pơlei Jêrusalem đe phă pơrăm păng lu 'măng jang ŭnh kư̆m sa đĭ boih. Bĕ lu bơ̆n pơdơ̆ng man ming dur pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng, wă kơ lu bơ̆n huay pă kơ mơlâu kơ đe.”

English: And I told them of the hand of my God which had been good upon me, and also of the king’s words that he had spoken to me. So they said, “Let us rise up and build.” Then they set their hands to this good work.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m roi dơ̆ng kơ lu sư băt kơ tơpang ti 'mêm mơnat Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei tơgŭm inh, păng đơ̆ng nơ̆r pơtao, khan kơ inh. Lu sư khan: “Iung bĕ păng man hơmet ming dơ̆ng!” Thoi noh jang tơdrong jang 'lơ̆ng dêh 'nâu.

English: But when Sanballat the Horonite, Tobiah the Ammonite official, and Geshem the Arab heard of it, they laughed at us and despised us, and said, “What is this thing that you are doing? Will you rebel against the king?”
Bahnar: Sanbalat, bơngai Hôrôn, Tôbia đĭch đam Ammôn păng Gêsem bơngai Arâp kơtơ̆ng tơdrong jang 'nâu, na lu sư hiĕk che bơle kơ lu nhôn, lu sư khan: Lu iĕm pơm kiơ̆ lu iĕm wă blơ̆ pơtao hă?

English: So I answered them, and said to them, “The God of heaven Himself will prosper us; therefore we His servants will arise and build, but you have no heritage or right or memorial in Jerusalem.”
Bahnar: Na inh tơl lu sư: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh gô ăn kơ lu nhôn đĭch đam Sư, gô pơm pơkeh tơdrong jang 'nâu, lu nhôn gô man pơdơ̆ng hơmet ming mă-lei gah lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh đei tơdrong kiơ 'bơm hăm pơlei Jêrusalem 'nâu.

English: Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brethren the priests and built the Sheep Gate; they consecrated it and hung its doors. They built as far as the Tower of the Hundred, and consecrated it, then as far as the Tower of Hananel.
Bahnar: Êliasip 'bok soi tơm hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư 'bok soi nai iung man pơdơ̆ng ming 'măng jang Triu. Lu sư 'măn anih noh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng pơm 'bar pah tơnang 'măng lu sư 'măn anih noh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh truh tơ hnam Thôt Mêa păng truh tơ hnam Thôt Hananêl.

English: Next to Eliashib the men of Jericho built. And next to them Zaccur the son of Imri built.
Bahnar: Tơtil Êliasip bơngai pơlei Jêrikô man; tơtil lu đe noh Saku, kon drŏ-nglo Imri man

English: Also the sons of Hassenaah built the Fish Gate; they laid its beams and hung its doors with its bolts and bars.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Hasêna man 'măng jang Ka, lu sư pơm jrăng păng tơnang 'măng păng chơkăl.

English: And next to them Meremoth the son of Urijah, the son of Koz, made repairs. Next to them Meshullam the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel, made repairs. Next to them Zadok the son of Baana made repairs.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu đe noh Mêrêmôt, kon drŏ-nglo Uri, sâu kơ Hakkôs man hơmet, tơtil lu đe noh, Mêsulam kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia, sâu Mêsêsabeh man hơmet, tơtil lu đe noh Sađôk, kon drŏ-nglo Baana man hơmet.

English: Next to them the Tekoites made repairs; but their nobles did not put their shoulders to the work of their Lord.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu đe noh, lu bơngai pơlei Têkôa man, mă-lei gah lu bơngai mơdrŏng lu sư kuă kơ bơ̆jang tơgŭm ôh kơ lu yŏng sư kơdih.

English: Moreover Jehoiada the son of Paseah and Meshullam the son of Besodeiah repaired the Old Gate; they laid its beams and hung its doors, with its bolts and bars.
Bahnar: Jôiađa kon drŏ-nglo Pasêa păng Mêsulam, kon drŏ-nglo Bôsôđeia man hơmet ming lu 'măng jang So; lu sư pơdơ̆ng jrăng, đei tơnang 'măng jang păng chơkăl.

English: And next to them Melatiah the Gibeonite, Jadon the Meronothite, the men of Gibeon and Mizpah, repaired the residence of the governor of the region beyond the River.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu đe noh Mêlatia bơngai Gibeôn păng Jađôn bơngai Mêrônôt, lu bơngai Gibeôn păng lu bơngai Mispa man hơmet, lu đe noh lu sư kon pơlei oei gah Pah To Đak Krong pơgơ̆r.

English: Next to him Uzziel the son of Harhaiah, one of the goldsmiths, made repairs. Also next to him Hananiah, one of the perfumers, made repairs; and they fortified Jerusalem as far as the Broad Wall.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu đe noh Usiêl kon drŏ-nglo Harhaia đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai hling maih pơm hơmet; tơtil bơngai noh Hanania, lu bơngai pơm pơgang 'bâu phu pơm hơmet ming Lu sư hơmet ming pơlei tih Jêrusalem truh tơ Dur Să.

English: And next to them Rephaiah the son of Hur, leader of half the district of Jerusalem, made repairs.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu sư, Rêphaia kon drŏ-nglo Hur bơngai pơgơ̆r minh puăt pơlei Jêrusalem man pơdơ̆ng ming

English: Next to them Jedaiah the son of Harumaph made repairs in front of his house. And next to him Hattush the son of Hashabniah made repairs.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu sư Jêđaia kon drŏ-nglo Hurumap pơm hơmet ming tơklă anăp hnam sư, tơtil bơngai noh Hatus kon drŏ-nglo Hasapneia pơm hơmet.

English: Malchijah the son of Harim and Hashub the son of Pahath-Moab repaired another section, as well as the Tower of the Ovens.
Bahnar: Malkija, kon drŏ-nglo Harim păng Hasup kon drŏ-nglo Pahat Môap pơm hơmet minh puăt nai păng hnam thôt Tơnuh ŭnh.

English: And next to him was Shallum the son of Hallohesh, leader of half the district of Jerusalem; he and his daughters made repairs.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu đe noh Sallum kon drŏ-nglo Halôhes pơgơ̆r minh puăt pơlei Jêrusalem păng lu kon drŏ-kăn sư pơm hơmet.

English: Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah repaired the Valley Gate. They built it, hung its doors with its bolts and bars, and repaired a thousand cubits of the wall as far as the Refuse Gate.
Bahnar: Hanun păng kon pơlei Sanôa hơmet 'măng jang Thŭng. Lu sư man đei tơnang 'măng păng chơkăl păng man minh-rơbâu hloka dur truh tơ 'măng jang Râm.

English: Malchijah the son of Rechab, leader of the district of Beth Haccerem, repaired the Refuse Gate; he built it and hung its doors with its bolts and bars.
Bahnar: Malkija kon drŏ-nglo Rêkap pơgơ̆r tơring char Bêt Hakarem hơmet 'măng jang Râm; lu sư man, đei tơnang 'măng păng chơkăl.

English: Shallun the son of Col-Hozeh, leader of the district of Mizpah, repaired the Fountain Gate; he built it, covered it, hung its doors with its bolts and bars, and repaired the wall of the Pool of Shelah by the King’s Garden, as far as the stairs that go down from the City of David.
Bahnar: Sallum kon drŏ-nglo Kôlhôse pơgơ̆r tơring Mispa, hơmet 'măng jang đak Hơlŭng sư man bơbŭng đei tơnang 'măng păng chơkăl kư̆m man dur dơnâu Sêlô jê̆ pơgar pơkao pơtao păng truh tơ jơ̆ng kung jur đơ̆ng pơlei Đawit.

English: After him Nehemiah the son of Azbuk, leader of half the district of Beth Zur, made repairs as far as the place in front of the tombs of David, to the man-made pool, and as far as the House of the Mighty.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh Nêhêmi, kon drŏ-nglo Asbuk pơgơ̆r minh puăt tơring Bêt Sur, man hơmet dur truh tơ bơsat Đawit, truh tơ đak dơnâu đe pơm păng truh tơ hnam lu bơngai nuih kơtang.

English: After him the Levites, under Rehum the son of Bani, made repairs. Next to him Hashabiah, leader of half the district of Keilah, made repairs for his district.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh bơngai Lêwi Rêhum kon drŏ-nglo Bani pơm yŏng đei pơm hơmet, tơtil bơngai noh Hasabia pơgơ̆r minh puăt tơring Keila pơm hơmet ăn kơ tơring char sư kơdih.

English: After him their brethren, under Bavai the son of Henadad, leader of the other half of the district of Keilah, made repairs.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh, đei lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư pơm hơmet, Binnui kon drŏ-nglo Hênadat pơgơ̆r minh puăt tơring Keila pơm hơmet.

English: And next to him Ezer the son of Jeshua, the leader of Mizpah, repaired another section in front of the Ascent to the Armory at the buttress.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh Êser kon drŏ-nglo Jêsua pơgơ̆r Mispa pơm hơmet minh puăt tơklă tơngơ̆ năm tŏk tơ hnam Mong Tơmam Tơblah, tơ mum pơlei.

English: After him Baruch the son of Zabbai carefully repaired the other section, from the buttress to the door of the house of Eliashib the high priest.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng bơngai noh đei Baruk, kon drŏ-nglo Sabai pơm hơmet, minh puăt nai đơ̆ng mum Pơlei truh tơ 'măng mơ̆t tơ hnam Êliasip 'bok soi tơm pơm.

English: After him Meremoth the son of Urijah, the son of Koz, repaired another section, from the door of the house of Eliashib to the end of the house of Eliashib.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng bơngai noh đei Mêsêmôt, kon drŏ-nglo Uri sâu Hakkôs pơm hơmet minh puăt nai đơ̆ng 'măng mơ̆t tơ hnam Êliasip truh tơ tôch hnam sư.

English: And after him the priests, the men of the plain, made repairs.
Bahnar: Pơtrơp đơ̆ng sư đei lu 'bok soi, lu bơngai oei lăm thŭng glă Jôrđăn pơm hơmet.

English: After him Benjamin and Hasshub made repairs opposite their house. After them Azariah the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ananiah, made repairs by his house.
Bahnar: Tơtil lu đe noh Bênjamin păng Hasup pơm hơmet tơklă hnam sư kơdih, Tơtil lu đe noh Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Mêsaia, sâu Anania pơm hơmet tơtil hnam sư kơdih.

English: After him Binnui the son of Henadad repaired another section, from the house of Azariah to the buttress, even as far as the corner.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh Binnui kon drŏ-nglo Hênadat pơm hơmet minh puăt nai, đơ̆ng hnam Asaria truh tơ mum Pơlei.

English: Palal the son of Uzai made repairs opposite the buttress, and on the tower which projects from the king’s upper house that was by the court of the prison. After him Pedaiah the son of Parosh made repairs.
Bahnar: Palal kon drŏ-nglo Usai pơm hơmet tơklă kuĕl mum Pơlei truh kơpal kơ hnam pơtao, anih Thôt kơjung tơklă cham linh gak, 'blă kơ bơngai noh đei Pêdaia kon drŏ-nglo Parôs pơm hơmet.

English: Moreover the Nethinim who dwelt in Ophel made repairs as far as the place in front of the Water Gate toward the east, and on the projecting tower.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bơngai Nêthiniam awih awăn lăm hnam Kră Yang oei tơ hnam thôt Ôphêl man hơmet truh tơ anih tơklă 'măng jang Đak tơ gah hơlĕch, truh tơ hnam Thôt kơjung.

English: After them the Tekoites repaired another section, next to the great projecting tower, and as far as the wall of Ophel.
Bahnar: 'Blă kơ bơngai noh đei lu bơngai pơlei Thêkô pơm hơmet minh pah nai tơklă hnam thôt kơjung păng truh tơ dur Ôphêl.

English: Beyond the Horse Gate the priests made repairs, each in front of his own house.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tơm hơmet gah kơpal kơ 'măng jang Aseh rim 'nu pơm hơmet tơklă hnam lu sư kơdih.

English: After them Zadok the son of Immer made repairs in front of his own house. After him Shemaiah the son of Shechaniah, the keeper of the East Gate, made repairs.
Bahnar: Pơtrơp đơ̆ng đe noh, Sađơ̆k kon drŏ-nglo Immer pơm hơmet tơklă hnam lu sư kơdih, 'blă kơ đe noh đei Sêmaia, kon drŏ-nglo Sêkania bơngai wei-lăng 'măng dur pơm hơmet.

English: After him Hananiah the son of Shelemiah, and Hanun, the sixth son of Zalaph, repaired another section. After him Meshullam the son of Berechiah made repairs in front of his dwelling.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh, Hanania kon drŏ-nglo Sêlêmaia păng Hanun, kon mă pơđăm Salap, pơm hơmet păng pah nai, tơtil lu đe noh Mêsulam, kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia pơm hơmet tơklă hnam sư kơdih.

English: After him Malchijah, one of the goldsmiths, made repairs as far as the house of the Nethinim and of the merchants, in front of the Miphkad Gate, and as far as the upper room at the corner.
Bahnar: Tơtil bơngai noh Malkija lu bơngai hling maih pơm hơmet truh tơ hnam bơngai Nêhinim awih awăn lăm hnam Kră Yang păng lu bơngai mơdro sa, tơklă 'măng jang Jô Miphơkat păng truh tơ anih kơjung mum pơlei tơngơ̆ kơjung.

English: And between the upper room at the corner, as far as the Sheep Gate, the goldsmiths and the merchants made repairs.
Bahnar: Lu khŭl bơ̆jang hling maih păng lu bơngai mơdro sa kư̆m wang pơm hơmet dur pơlei tih, đơ̆ng tơngơ̆ kơjung truh tơ 'măng jang Triu.

English: But it so happened, when Sanballat heard that we were rebuilding the wall, that he was furious and very indignant, and mocked the Jews.
Bahnar: Tơdah Sanbalat băt kơ nhôn man hơmet ming dur pơlei dơ̆ng, na sư hil blĕk dêh păng hiĕk ăr kơ bơngai Juđa.

English: And he spoke before his brethren and the army of Samaria, and said, “What are these feeble Jews doing? Will they fortify themselves? Will they offer sacrifices? Will they complete it in a day? Will they revive the stones from the heaps of rubbish—stones that are burned?”
Bahnar: Sư khan 'bơ̆t anăp lu 'nhŏng oh sư păng lu linh char Samari; lu bơngai Juđa rơdu tơrăn ei pơm kiơ? Lu sư tơchĕng khan kĕ man ming dur pơlei ei hă? Lu sư khan wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi hă? Lăm minh năr lu sư gô pơm keh hă? Tơmo đêl ŭnh sa đĭ boih, lu sư hăm wă gơh iŏk đĭ jing 'mui teh pơm pơjing thoi tơmo dơ̆ng hă?

English: Now Tobiah the Ammonite was beside him, and he said, “Whatever they build, if even a fox goes up on it, he will break down their stone wall.”
Bahnar: Tôbia, bơngai Ammôn, oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng sư khan: Dur mă lu sư man păng tơmo thoi noh tơdah đei mơja tŏk hao kư̆m păk pơchah đĭ.

English: Hear, O our God, for we are despised; turn their reproach on their own heads, and give them as plunder to a land of captivity!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn ơi! Mơ̆ng bĕ; yua kơ lu nhôn đe pơjăm, apinh Ih tuh bĕ tơdrong ưh kơ hiôk lu sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l lu sư; păng jao ăn bĕ kơ lu sư pơm bơnă kơ teh đak đe.

English: Do not cover their iniquity, and do not let their sin be blotted out from before You; for they have provoked You to anger before the builders.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ đơ̆p lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư, 'nĕ kơ sŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp Ih; yua kơ 'bơ̆t anăp Ih lu bơngai man dur, lu sư tơblĕk Ih.

English: So we built the wall, and the entire wall was joined together up to half its height, for the people had a mind to work.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu nhôn man hơmet dur pơlei dơ̆ng, lu dur tơklep tơlir băl kơjung truh kơ minh puăt, yua kơ kon pơlei adrin 'maih jang.

English: Now it happened, when Sanballat, Tobiah, the Arabs, the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites heard that the walls of Jerusalem were being restored and the gaps were beginning to be closed, that they became very angry
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah Sanbalat, Tôbia lu bơngai Arâp, kon pơlei Ammôn păng kon pơlei Asdôt băt kơ tơdrong jang pơm hơmet ming dur pơlei Jêrusalem rai tŏk 'net 'net, lu bơlôh pơchah man hơmet ming 'lơ̆ng na lu sư blĕk păng hil dêh.

English: and all of them conspired together to come and attack Jerusalem and create confusion.
Bahnar: Na krao akŭm băl đĭ-đăng wă năm blah pơlei Jêrusalem păng wă pơrŭng lu nhôn hơwơ̆l hơwang.

English: Nevertheless we made our prayer to our God, and because of them we set a watch against them day and night.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu nhôn krao khan apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn păng rơih chă bơngai kral gak kơmăng kơ'năr wă găn lu sư.

English: Then Judah said, “The strength of the laborers is failing, and there is so much rubbish that we are not able to build the wall.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Juđa khan: Đei lơ tơmo gŏch pơchah na jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai tung hơnong pơdŭ đĭ gleh lap boih; lu nhôn ưh pă kĕ gơh man dur pơlei dơ̆ng.

English: And our adversaries said, “They will neither know nor see anything, till we come into their midst and kill them and cause the work to cease.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai areh kơ lu nhôn khan thoi âu: Lu sư gô ưh kơ băt ưh kơ 'bôh dôm tơdrong noh, gô dĭng lu bơ̆n truh tơ lăm lu sư, pơlôch đĭ lu sư păng pơm kơ lu sư pơdơh kơ tơdrong jang.

English: So it was, when the Jews who dwelt near them came, that they told us ten times, “From whatever place you turn, they will be upon us.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei Juđa oei hơdai hăm lu sư, truh tơ mơjĭt wơ̆t đei roi tơbăt ăn kơ lu nhôn thoi âu: Đei lu ayăt đơ̆ng puăn pah mum gô truh wă blah lu bơ̆n.

English: Therefore I positioned men behind the lower parts of the wall, at the openings; and I set the people according to their families, with their swords, their spears, and their bows.
Bahnar: Inh pơm pơjing lu kơđông tơ ala pah rŏng kơ dur pơlei păng tơ lu anih rơhơi; inh dan kon pơlei kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung tơ noh đei chĕp đao hơlă păng hră.

English: And I looked, and arose and said to the nobles, to the leaders, and to the rest of the people, “Do not be afraid of them. Remember the Lord, great and awesome, and fight for your brethren, your sons, your daughters, your wives, and your houses.”
Bahnar: Inh iung chă lăng păng pơma dơnuh hăm lu bơngai mơdrŏng, lu bơngai pơm kuan tih păng lu kon pơlei thoi âu: 'Nĕ kơ hli kơ lu sư; athei 'blŏk kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh păng trŏ kơ pơyom kơkuh, adrin tơblah dŏng lu 'nhŏng oh, dŏng kon tơdăm kon adruh lu bơ̆n, dŏng akăn păng hnam dơnŏ lu bơ̆n.

English: And it happened, when our enemies heard that it was known to us, and that God had brought their plot to nothing, that all of us returned to the wall, everyone to his work.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu ayăt kơ lu nhôn băt kơ lu nhôn băt kơ tơdrong noh păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơrăm lê̆ boih tơdrong tơchĕng lu sư, thoi noh lu nhôn wơ̆t bơ̆jang man dur dơ̆ng rim 'nu kư̆m wơ̆t bơ̆jang tơdrong jang sư kơdih.

English: So it was, from that time on, that half of my servants worked at construction, while the other half held the spears, the shields, the bows, and wore armor; and the leaders were behind all the house of Judah.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr noh minh puăt lu đĭch đam inh bơ̆jang man pơdơ̆ng oei minh puăt lu sư chĕp hơlă khêl đao hră, hrŭk ao bơsei gak; lu kră wei-lăng mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơgŭm gah rŏng lu adrĕch Juđa.

English: Those who built on the wall, and those who carried burdens, loaded themselves so that with one hand they worked at construction, and with the other held a weapon.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơ'nah man hơmet ming dur, lu bơngai mơ'nah tung hơnong pơdŭ păng lu bơngai hơtŏk tơ kơpal, minh pah ti bơ̆jang minh pah ti chĕp tơmam tơblah.

English: Every one of the builders had his sword girded at his side as he built. And the one who sounded the trumpet was beside me.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai man hơmet, rim 'nu kư̆m đei đao lu sư kơdih tơ̆n tơ kơiĕng, đơ̆ng noh man hơmet; bĕ lu bơngai hlôm keng ngôi 'bơ̆t jê̆ inh.

English: Then I said to the nobles, the rulers, and the rest of the people, “The work is great and extensive, and we are separated far from one another on the wall.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu bơngai mơdrŏng, lu pơm kuan tih păng kon pơlei pơla mă oei đei, thoi âu: Tơdrong jang tih să păng kơjung lu bơ̆n jang ataih băl bu tơ âu, bu tơ to.

English: Wherever you hear the sound of the trumpet, rally to us there. Our God will fight for us.”
Bahnar: Tơ anih ayơ lu iĕm kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng, na akŭm pơpôi băl tơduă lu iĕm tơ noh; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n gô blah dŏng lu bơ̆n.

English: So we labored in the work, and half of the men held the spears from daybreak until the stars appeared.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn bơ̆jang thoi noh; minh puăt lu sư chĕp đao hơlă đơ̆ng hrôih truh tơ rang khei kơmăng.

English: At the same time I also said to the people, “Let each man and his servant stay at night in Jerusalem, that they may be our guard by night and a working party by day.”
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah noh, inh kư̆m pơma hăm kon pơlei thoi âu: Rim 'nu hơdai hăm lu bơngai đĭch sư kơdih tep kơmăng lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, kơmăng athei gak kơchăng, păng kơ'năr bơ̆jang.

English: So neither I, my brethren, my servants, nor the men of the guard who followed me took off our clothes, except that everyone took them off for washing.
Bahnar: Inh, lu 'nhŏng oh inh, dôm lu bơngai đĭch đam inh, hăm lu linh wei gak kiơ̆ inh hai, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu mă gơh plôh ao lu sư, rim 'nu 'băk khêl đao, hơlă tơmam tơblah sư kơdih.

English: And there was a great outcry of the people and their wives against their Jewish brethren.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma jŏk tơtok tih lăm lu kon pơlei păng akăn lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư kơdih bơngai Juđa.

English: For there were those who said, “We, our sons, and our daughters are many; therefore let us get grain, that we may eat and live.”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai khan: Kon tơdăm kon adruh lu nhôn lơ, na lu nhôn kư̆m athei đei phe 'ba kơna gơh arih.

English: There were also some who said, “We have mortgaged our lands and vineyards and houses, that we might buy grain because of the famine.”
Bahnar: Kŭm đei bơngai khan dơ̆ng: Lăm kơplah đei pơngot rơwĕt, lu nhôn pơjao chŭn mir pơgar hơmu păng hnam dơnŏ lu nhôn, wă kơ đei phe 'ba sa mơ̆n.

English: There were also those who said, “We have borrowed money for the king’s tax on our lands and vineyards.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei bơngai nai khan dơ̆ng; lu nhôn kư̆m đei pơjao chŭn, mir hơmu, na wă kơ đei jên ăn kơ pơtao.

English: Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brethren, our children as their children; and indeed we are forcing our sons and our daughters to be slaves, and some of our daughters have been brought into slavery. It is not in our power to redeem them, for other men have our lands and vineyards.”
Bahnar: Akâu akar lu nhôn kư̆m nhen akâu akar lu 'nhŏng oh lu nhôn mơ̆n, kon tơdăm lu nhôn kư̆m nhen kon tơdăm lu sư mơ̆n; na dang ei lu nhôn rôp kon tơdăm păng kon adruh lu nhôn pơm đĭch hă păng kư̆m đei boih kon adruh lu nhôn pơm đĭch boih, mă tơpă lu nhôn pă đei gơh wă huai iŏk dơ̆ng; yua kơ chŭn mir păng pơgar hơmu lu nhôn đĭ tơ lu đe nai iŏk boih.

English: And I became very angry when I heard their outcry and these words.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh kơtơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r âu păng nơ̆r krao ôr lu sư, na inh blĕk dêh.

English: After serious thought, I rebuked the nobles and rulers, and said to them, “Each of you is exacting usury from his brother.” So I called a great assembly against them.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m hiơ̆k gah tơdrong noh, 'maih chrih kơ lu bơngai mơdrŏng păng lu bơngai pơm kuan tih: Inh khan: Lu iĕm chă jên kiĕng đơ̆ng lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n! Inh pơtơm akŭm minh khŭl lơ wă jet lu sư.

English: And I said to them, “According to our ability we have redeemed our Jewish brethren who were sold to the nations. Now indeed, will you even sell your brethren? Or should they be sold to us?” Then they were silenced and found nothing to say.
Bahnar: Khan thoi âu: “Kiơ̆ kơ lu bơ̆n gơh đei huai boih 'nhŏng oh lu bơ̆n, bơngai Juđa mă đe tĕch tơ lu adrĕch nai, na dang ei iĕm wă 'maih tĕch lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n dơ̆ng hă? Na lu sư wă tĕch tơ lu bơ̆n dơ̆ng hă?” Lu sư ngăn hreh ưh pă gơh wă pơma kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: Then I said, “What you are doing is not good. Should you not walk in the fear of our God because of the reproach of the nations, our enemies?
Bahnar: Inh khan dơ̆ng: “Tơdrong mă lu iĕm pơm noh ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ôh hăm trŏ lu iĕm arih sa kiơ̆ trong băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hli kơ lu bơngai ayăt che bơle hiĕk ăr kơ bơ̆n.

English: I also, with my brethren and my servants, am lending them money and grain. Please, let us stop this usury!
Bahnar: Inh, lu 'nhŏng oh inh păng lu đĭch đam inh kư̆m đei asong ăn kơ lu sư mưng jên păng 'ba, mă-lei inh apinh lu iĕm athei 'nĕ kơ iŏk jên kiĕng.

English: Restore now to them, even this day, their lands, their vineyards, their olive groves, and their houses, also a hundredth of the money and the grain, the new wine and the oil, that you have charged them.”
Bahnar: Inh apinh lu iĕm năr âu hloi, athei pơdrâu bĕ kơ lu sư chŭn mir, pơgar hơmu, pơgar ôliwơ păng hnam lu sư, kư̆m pơdrâu minh lăm mơjĭt gah jên, phe 'ba, sik păng đak rơmă, mă lu iĕm đei pơgŏ đơ̆ng lu sư.

English: So they said, “We will restore it, and will require nothing from them; we will do as you say.” Then I called the priests, and required an oath from them that they would do according to this promise.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan. “Lu nhôn gô pơdrâu đĭ păng kư̆m ưh pă wă apinh kiơ đơ̆ng lu sư dơ̆ng; lu nhôn gô pơm trŏ thoi nơ̆r ih khan, inh krao lu 'bok soi tơm wă kơ lu sư drơ̆ng kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r lu sư pơkă noh.

English: Then I shook out the fold of my garment and said, “So may God shake out each man from his house, and from his property, who does not perform this promise. Even thus may he be shaken out and emptied.” And all the assembly said, “Amen!” and praised the LORD. Then the people did according to this promise.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m tơtuh tơdrơi ao inh na khan: Tơdah bơngai bu ưh kơ wei răk pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r pơkă âu, na apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơtuh lê̆ hnam, mŭk drăm bơngai ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r pơkă 'nâu păng tơtuh kơ bơngai noh jing hoh-hoy! Tơpôl lơ kư̆m wang drơ̆ng: “A-men!” Lu sư ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, lu bơngai ei pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r đei pơkă.

English: Moreover, from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year until the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes, twelve years, neither I nor my brothers ate the governor’s provisions.
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng, đơ̆ng năr inh pơm kră wei-lăng lăm dêh Juđa wă khan đơ̆ng sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt truh tơ sơnăm pêng-jĭt 'bar chăl pơtao Artaserses, jô̆ đĭ 'bar-jĭt 'bar sơnăm inh păng lu 'nhŏng oh jang hơdai inh ưh kơ đei sa jên dah tơmam đơ̆ng đe apah inh pơm yŏng ôh.

English: But the former governors who were before me laid burdens on the people, and took from them bread and wine, besides forty shekels of silver. Yes, even their servants bore rule over the people, but I did not do so, because of the fear of God.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu kră wei-lăng adrol kơ inh pơgŏ kon pơlei tơgŭm tơmam sa păng sik, 'nguaih kơ puăn-jĭt sêikơl jên hu; lu bơngai đĭch đam kiơ̆ wei-lăng sư kư̆m wang chă apinh đơ̆ng kon pơlei đơ̆ng, mă-lei gah inh ưh kơ pơm thoi noh ôh; yua kơ hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Indeed, I also continued the work on this wall, and we did not buy any land. All my servants were gathered there for the work.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m bơwei kơjăp lăm tơdrong jang man hơmet ming dur 'nâu kư̆m ưh kơ đei răt minh hlak chŭn ayơ păng wă kơ lu đĭch đam inh akŭm pơpôi băl bơ̆jang tơ noh.

English: And at my table were one hundred and fifty Jews and rulers, besides those who came to us from the nations around us.
Bahnar: Tơ anih gơ'bang inh sŏng sa kư̆m đei minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu bơngai Juđa păng kuan tih, ưh kơ đei jô̆ 'nguaih kơ bơngai tăp dăr kơ nhôn năm ngôi.

English: Now that which was prepared daily was one ox and six choice sheep. Also fowl were prepared for me, and once every ten days an abundance of all kinds of wine. Yet in spite of this I did not demand the governor’s provisions, because the bondage was heavy on this people.
Bahnar: Hơmet tơmam sa rim năr minh pôm rơmo tơdrâu tŏ triu đei rơih iŏk; kư̆m hơmet lu 'nhĕm iĕr, bip, kiơ̆ kơ lăm mơjĭt năr đei hơmet tôm kơ tơmam đei sik lơ. Mă-lei ră inh ưh kơ wă ôh apinh tơmam sa kơ inh kră wei-lăng păng kơnh tơpŭ pơm anat kơ kon pơlei pơla đĕch.

English: Remember me, my God, for good, according to all that I have done for this people.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh ơi! Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ inh dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng inh đei pơm boih kơ lu kon pơlei âu.

English: Now it happened when Sanballat, Tobiah, Geshem the Arab, and the rest of our enemies heard that I had rebuilt the wall, and that there were no breaks left in it (though at that time I had not hung the doors in the gates)
Bahnar: Tơdah đe roi Sanbalat, Tôbia, Gêsem, bơngai Arâp păng lu ayăt kơ lu nhôn nai, băt kơ inh man hơmet ming dur boih, ưh pă đei bơlôh ayơ dơ̆ng, mă khan inh tam mă pơm lu 'măng iĕ tơ 'măng jang.

English: that Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, “Come, let us meet together among the villages in the plain of Ono.” But they thought to do me harm.
Bahnar: Na Sanbalat păng Gêsem, wơh bơngai năm truh tơ inh khan: Năm bĕ bơ̆n gô tơ'bơ̆p băl lăm minh pôm pơlei ayơ tơ thŭng Ônô,a mă-lei lu sư chă đon wă pơrăm inh.

English: So I sent messengers to them, saying, “I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down. Why should the work cease while I leave it and go down to you?”
Bahnar: Inh wơh bơngai jang năm truh khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: Inh đei tơdrong jang kăl ưh kơ wăn năm, liơ mă inh gơh lê̆ tơdrong jang na jur năm tơ lu iĕm?

English: But they sent me this message four times, and I answered them in the same manner.
Bahnar: Lu sư wơh bơngai năm truh tơ inh puăn 'măng hloi, mă-lei inh khan lei-lăi ưh kơ wăn năm.

English: Then Sanballat sent his servant to me as before, the fifth time, with an open letter in his hand.
Bahnar: 'Măng mă pơđăm, Sanbalat wơh minh 'nu bơngai đĭch sư kư̆m năm thoi adrol, đei chĕp kơthơ mă ưh kơ 'blir lê̆ kơthơ noh.

English: In it was written: It is reported among the nations, and Geshem says, that you and the Jews plan to rebel; therefore, according to these rumors, you are rebuilding the wall, that you may be their king.
Bahnar: Lăm kơthơ đei chih thoi âu: Lăm lu adrĕch adrung ih đei kơtơ̆ng ang păng Gêsem khan thoi âu: Ih hăm lu bơngai Juđa chă đon wă blơ̆ teh đak; yua kơ thoi noh na ih oei man hơmet ming dur; đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r khan ih 'maih wă pơm pơtao lu sư.

English: And you have also appointed prophets to proclaim concerning you at Jerusalem, saying, “There is a king in Judah!” Now these matters will be reported to the king. So come, therefore, and let us consult together.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m đei pơjing lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol wă bơtho ră roi gah ih tơ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem khan: Đei minh 'nu pơtao lăm dêh char Juđa, đe gô pơtruh dôm nơ̆r âu kơ pơtao, 'lơ̆ng hloh năm bĕ wă kơ lu bơ̆n đei pơma dơnuh.

English: Then I sent to him, saying, “No such things as you say are being done, but you invent them in your own heart.”
Bahnar: Inh wơh bơngai năm khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Dôm tơdrong ih khan noh, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu pơm ôh; noh đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m ih chă pơm đĕch.”

English: For they all were trying to make us afraid, saying, “Their hands will be weakened in the work, and it will not be done.” Now therefore, O God, strengthen my hands.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư wă tơhli lu nhôn; inh păng đĭ-đăng nhôn hli; lu sư khan: Ti lu sư gô gleh lap, ưh pă gơh jang dơ̆ng, na dang ei hloi, ơ Kră Yang pơm bĕ kơ ti inh jing pran.

English: Afterward I came to the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah, the son of Mehetabel, who was a secret informer; and he said, “Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple, and let us close the doors of the temple, for they are coming to kill you; indeed, at night they will come to kill you.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, inh mơ̆t lăm hnam Sêmaia kon drŏ-nglo Đêlaia, sâu Mêhatabêl bơngai đe chĭt sư boih khan: Lu bơ̆n athei tơ'bơ̆p băl lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lăm tŏk-bŏk hnam akŭm, đơ̆ng noh lu bơ̆n gô tang lê̆ 'măng hnam akŭm, yua kơ lu sư wă năm pơlôch ih; lu sư chă đon truh wă pơlôch ih kơmăng.

English: And I said, “Should such a man as I flee? And who is there such as I who would go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in!”
Bahnar: Inh khan: Minh 'nu bơngai thoi inh âu wă kơdâu ôn hă? Bơngai bu thoi inh âu mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm na mă gơh arih hă? Inh ưh kơ mơ̆t ôh.

English: Then I perceived that God had not sent him at all, but that he pronounced this prophecy against me because Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.
Bahnar: Inh lăng băt ưh kơ trŏ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh sư năm ôh, mă-lei sư pơma nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol noh ayăt kơ inh. Yua kơ Tôbia păng Sanbalat đei yua sư noh.

English: For this reason he was hired, that I should be afraid and act that way and sin, so that they might have cause for an evil report, that they might reproach me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơ noh. Đe apah jên wă pơm kơ inh hli, wă pơhlŭ inh pơm yoch, wă gơh roi tơdrong kơnê̆ păng wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh.

English: My God, remember Tobiah and Sanballat, according to these their works, and the prophetess Noadiah and the rest of the prophets who would have made me afraid.
Bahnar: Ơ! Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ bre Tôbia păng Sanbalat kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong 'nâu mă bre sư đei pơm boih; kư̆m apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ Nôđia, bơngai drŏ-kăn khan lê̆ adrol păng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol nai kư̆m 'maih wă pơm kơ inh hli tơrơ!

English: So the wall was finished on the twenty-fifth day of Elul, in fifty-two days.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, năr 'bar-jĭt pơđăm khei Êlun dur pơlei man hơmet keh, đĭ pơđăm-jĭt 'bar năr.

English: And it happened, when all our enemies heard of it, and all the nations around us saw these things, that they were very disheartened in their own eyes; for they perceived that this work was done by our God.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu nhôn băt dôm tơdrong noh, na lu kon pơlei oei tăp dăr kơ lu nhôn kư̆m hli tơrơ păng jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ hiôk; yua kơ lu sư băt tơdrong jang âu gơh keh jing đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn.

English: Also in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah, and the letters of Tobiah came to them.
Bahnar: Kŭm lăm năr noh, đei lu bơngai mơdrŏng dêh char Juđa pơtruh chih kơthơ lơ ăn kơ Tôbia păng Tôbia kư̆m tơl nơ̆r chih tơwih kơthơ ăn kơ lu sư.

English: For many in Judah were pledged to him, because he was the son-in-law of Shechaniah the son of Arah, and his son Jehohanan had married the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơ lăm dêh Juđa đei lơ bơngai drơ̆ng pơkă wă pơgơ̆p hăm sư, sư ŏng Sêkania, kon drŏ-nglo Arah; păng Jêhôhanan, kon drŏ-nglo sư, iŏk akăn kon Mêsulam, kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia.

English: Also they reported his good deeds before me, and reported my words to him. Tobiah sent letters to frighten me.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơma roi 'bơ̆t anăp inh dôm lu tơdrong jang 'lơ̆ng păng lu đe noh roi dơ̆ng kơ sư đêl dôm nơ̆r inh pơma. Gah Tôbia chih tơwih kơthơ wă pơm ăn kơ inh hli tơrơ.

English: Then it was, when the wall was built and I had hung the doors, when the gatekeepers, the singers, and the Levites had been appointed
Bahnar: Kơplah man dur keh đang boih, inh kư̆m đei pơkăp lu 'măng, chă lu bơngai wei gak 'măng jang lu bơngai hơri păng lu bơngai Lêwi pơjao tơdrong jang kơ lu sư

English: that I gave the charge of Jerusalem to my brother Hanani, and Hananiah the leader of the citadel, for he was a faithful man and feared God more than many.
Bahnar: na inh pơjao ăn Hanani, oh inh păng Hanania pơm kuan wei-lăng hnam pơtao pơgơ̆r pơlei Jêrusalem yua kơ bre sư bơngai tơnăp păng hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hloh kơ lu bơngai nai.

English: And I said to them, “Do not let the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun is hot; and while they stand guard, let them shut and bar the doors; and appoint guards from among the inhabitants of Jerusalem, one at his watch station and another in front of his own house.”
Bahnar: Inh pơkă kơ lu sư thoi âu: 'Nĕ kơ pơih lu 'măng jang pơlei Jêrusalem adrol kơ măt 'năr tŏ, ih athei tang lê̆ 'măng-'mŏk păng chơkăl lê̆ đơ̆ng lăm kơplah bơngai oei gak 'măng tơ noh păng athei ăn bơngai lăm kon pơlei Jêrusalem tơplih băl gak, rim 'nu bơngai dơ̆ng tơklă hnam sư kơdih.

English: Now the city was large and spacious, but the people in it were few, and the houses were not rebuilt.
Bahnar: Pơlei tih să rơhơi, mă-lei kon pơlei oei lăm noh tŏ sĕt đĕch păng tam mă pơm hnam 'nao.

English: Then my God put it into my heart to gather the nobles, the rulers, and the people, that they might be registered by genealogy. And I found a register of the genealogy of those who had come up in the first return, and found written in it
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơtrŭt jơhngơ̆m krao pơpôi dôm lu bơngai mơdrŏng, lu pơm kuan păng kon pơlei wă chih tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch, inh đei chă 'bôh minh sơ̆p hla bơar chih gah adrĕch lu bơngai Juđa brŏk mă tăl blŭng-a păng lăm noh inh 'bôh đei chih thoi âu

English: These are the people of the province who came back from the captivity, of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away, and who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, everyone to his city.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu bơngai tơring Juđa đơ̆ng pơm bơnă gơh brŏk, wă khan lu bơngai đơ̆ng lăm khŭl mă Nebukatnessar rôp pơm bơnă; lu sư brŏk dơ̆ng tơ pơlei Jêrusalem lăm dêh Juđa, rim 'nu wih brŏk tơ pơlei sư kơdih

English: Those who came with Zerubbabel were Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, and Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel
Bahnar: Lu sư wih brŏk hơdai hăm Serubabel, Jêsua, Nêhêmi, Asaria, Ramia, Nahamani, Makđôkai; Bilsan, Mispêrêt, Bikwai, Nêhun păng Baanah. 'Nâu jô̆ kơsô̆ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: the sons of Parosh, two thousand one hundred and seventy-two
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Pharôt, 'bar-rơbâu minh-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of Shephatiah, three hundred and seventy-two
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Sêphatia, pêng-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of Arah, six hundred and fifty-two
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Arah, tơdrâu-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of Pahath-Moab, of the sons of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and eighteen
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Phahat Môap kon sâu Jêsua păng Jôap, đei 'bar-rơbâu tơhngam-hrĕng mơjĭt-tơhngam 'nu.

English: the sons of Elam, one thousand two hundred and fifty-four
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Êlam, minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt puăn 'nu.

English: the sons of Zattu, eight hundred and forty-five
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Satu, tơhngam-hrĕng puăn-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the sons of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Sakai, tơpơh-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu.

English: the sons of Binnui, six hundred and forty-eight
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Binnui, tơdrâu-hrĕng puăn-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the sons of Bebai, six hundred and twenty-eight
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Bêbai, tơdrâu-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the sons of Azgad, two thousand three hundred and twenty-two
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Agat, 'bar-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of Adonikam, six hundred and sixty-seven
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Ađônikam, tơdrâu-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt tơpơh 'nu.

English: the sons of Bigvai, two thousand and sixty-seven
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Bikwai, 'bar-rơbâu tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu.

English: the sons of Adin, six hundred and fifty-five
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Ađin, tơdrâu-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt pơđăm 'nu.

English: the sons of Ater of Hezekiah, ninety-eight
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Ater, gah adrĕch adrung Hesekia đei tơsĭn-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the sons of Hashum, three hundred and twenty-eight
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Hasum, pêng-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the sons of Bezai, three hundred and twenty-four
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Bêsai, pêng-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu.

English: the sons of Hariph, one hundred and twelve
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Harip, minh-hrĕng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of Gibeon, ninety-five
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Gibeôn, tơsĭn-jĭt pơđăm 'nu.

English: the men of Bethlehem and Netophah, one hundred and eighty-eight
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo pơlei Betlehem păng Natôpha, minh-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the men of Anathoth, one hundred and twenty-eight
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo pơlei Anatôt, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: the men of Beth Azmaveth, forty-two
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo pơlei Bêt Amawêt, puăn-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the men of Kirjath Jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty-three
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo pơlei Kiriap. Jêrim, bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng pơlei Kêphêra, păng bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrôt, tơpơh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pêng 'nu.

English: the men of Ramah and Geba, six hundred and twenty-one
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng pơlei Rama păng pơlei Gêba, tơdrâu-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt mônh 'nu.

English: the men of Michmas, one hundred and twenty-two
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai Mikmas, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the men of Bethel and Ai, one hundred and twenty-three
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng pơlei Bethel păng pơlei Ahi, minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng 'nu.

English: the men of the other Nebo, fifty-two
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng pơlei Nêbôna, pơđăm-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of the other Elam, one thousand two hundred and fifty-four
Bahnar: Gah lu kon sâu Êlam nai minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt puăn 'nu.

English: the sons of Harim, three hundred and twenty
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Harim, pêng-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'nu.

English: the sons of Jericho, three hundred and forty-five
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrikô pêng-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm 'nu.

English: the sons of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred and twenty-one
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu đơ̆ng pơlei Lôt, pơlei Hađit păng pơlei Ônô, tơpơh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt mônh 'nu.

English: the sons of Senaah, three thousand nine hundred and thirty.
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Sêna, pêng-rơbâu tơsĭn-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'nu.

English: The priests: the sons of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred and seventy-three
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tơm: Gah kon sâu Jêđaia, hnam Jêsua, tơsĭn-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt 'nu.

English: the sons of Immer, one thousand and fifty-two
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Imer, minh-rơbâu pơđăm-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: the sons of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred and forty-seven
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Pasur, minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt tơpơh 'nu.

English: the sons of Harim, one thousand and seventeen.
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Harim, minh-rơbâu mơjĭt-tơpơh 'nu.

English: The Levites: the sons of Jeshua, of Kadmiel, and of the sons of Hodevah, seventy-four.
Bahnar: Bơngai Lêwi: Kon sâu Jêsua đơ̆ng Katmiên, lăm adrĕch adrung Hôđêwa, tơpơh-jĭt puăn 'nu.

English: The singers: the sons of Asaph, one hundred and forty-eight.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơri: Gah kon sâu Asap, minh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: The gatekeepers: the sons of Shallum, the sons of Ater, the sons of Talmon, the sons of Akkub, the sons of Hatita, the sons of Shobai, one hundred and thirty-eight.
Bahnar: Bơngai gak 'măng jang: Gah kon sâu Sallum, kon sâu Ater kon Tamôn, kon sâu Akup, kon sâu Hatita păng kon sâu Sôbai, minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơhngam 'nu.

English: The Nethinim: the sons of Ziha, the sons of Hasupha, the sons of Tabbaoth
Bahnar: Bơngai đĭch đam kră hnam yang: Kon sâu Siha, kon sâu Hasupha kon sâu Tabaôt.

English: the sons of Keros, the sons of Sia, the sons of Padon
Bahnar: Kon sâu Kêros, kon sâu Sia, kon sâu Pađôn.

English: the sons of Lebana, the sons of Hagaba, the sons of Salmai
Bahnar: Kon sâu Lêbana, kon sâu Hagaba kon sâu Salmai.

English: the sons of Hanan, the sons of Giddel, the sons of Gahar
Bahnar: Kon sâu Hanan kon sâu Giđêl kon sâu Gahar.

English: the sons of Reaiah, the sons of Rezin, the sons of Nekoda
Bahnar: Kon sâu Rêya, kon sâu Rêsin kon sâu Nêkôđa.

English: the sons of Gazzam, the sons of Uzza, the sons of Paseah
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gasam kon sâu Usa kon sâu Pêsêa.

English: the sons of Besai, the sons of Meunim, the sons of Nephishesim
Bahnar: Kon sâu, Bêsai kon sâu Mêunim, kon sâu Nêphusêsim.

English: the sons of Bakbuk, the sons of Hakupha, the sons of Harhur
Bahnar: Kon sâu Bakbuk, kon sâu Hakupha kon sâu Hahur.

English: the sons of Bazlith, the sons of Mehida, the sons of Harsha
Bahnar: Kon sâu Baslit, kon sâu Mêhiđa, kon sâu Harsa.

English: the sons of Barkos, the sons of Sisera, the sons of Tamah
Bahnar: Kon sâu Barkô, kon sâu Sisera, kon sâu Thêma.

English: the sons of Neziah, and the sons of Hatipha.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Nêsia, kon sâu Hatipha.

English: The sons of Solomon’s servants: the sons of Sotai, the sons of Sophereth, the sons of Perida
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung lu đĭch Sôlômôn: Kon sâu Sôtai kon sâu Sôphêrêt, kon sâu Pêriđa.

English: the sons of Jaala, the sons of Darkon, the sons of Giddel
Bahnar: Kon sâu Jaala, kon sâu Darkôn, kon sâu Giđêl.

English: the sons of Shephatiah, the sons of Hattil, the sons of Pochereth of Zebaim, and the sons of Amon.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Sêphatia, kon sâu Hatil, kon sâu Phôkarêt, Hatsêbaim, kon sâu Ammôn.

English: All the Nethinim, and the sons of Solomon’s servants, were three hundred and ninety-two.
Bahnar: Akŭm pơđĭ lu đĭch đam kră hnam yang păng kon sâu lu đĭch đam Sôlômôn, pêng-hrĕng tơsĭn-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: And these were the ones who came up from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer, but they could not identify their father’s house nor their lineage, whether they were of Israel
Bahnar: 'Nâu jô̆ lu bơngai oei đơ̆ng pơlei Telharsa, Têlhatsa, Kêrup, Ađôn păng đơ̆ng Immer mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ băt hơđăl ôh adrĕch 'bok lu sư đơ̆ng adrĕch Isơrael.

English: the sons of Delaiah, the sons of Tobiah, the sons of Nekoda, six hundred and forty-two
Bahnar: Kon sâu Đêlaia, kon sâu Tôbia păng kon sâu Nêkôđa, tơdrâu-hrĕng puăn-jĭt 'bar 'nu.

English: and of the priests: the sons of Habaiah, the sons of Koz, the sons of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called by their name.
Bahnar: Gah đơ̆ng lu 'bok soi tơm: Kon sâu Hôbaia, kon sâu Hakkôs kon sâu Barsilai, bơngai iŏk akăn lăm lu kon drŏ-kăn Barsilai jô̆ anăn lu sư đơ̆ng pơlei Gileat.

English: These sought their listing among those who were registered by genealogy, but it was not found; therefore they were excluded from the priesthood as defiled.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai noh chơchă adrĕch adrung lu sư kơdih. Mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh, đơ̆ng noh ưh kơ gơh pơm 'bok soi, jô̆ khan 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And the governor said to them that they should not eat of the most holy things till a priest could consult with the Urim and Thummim.
Bahnar: Kră wei-lăng pơlei pơkă ưh kơ ăn sa tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng dĭng truh tơ đei minh 'nu 'bok soi gơh yua Urim păng Thumim iung apinh.

English: Altogether the whole assembly was forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty
Bahnar: Akŭm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei đei puăn-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu.

English: besides their male and female servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred and thirty-seven; and they had two hundred and forty-five men and women singers.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei jô̆ lu đĭch drŏ-nglo, đam drŏ-kăn lăm kon pơlei, jô̆ đei tơpơh-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơpơh 'nu; kư̆m đei 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm 'nu bơngai hơri, drŏ-nglo păng drŏ-kăn.

English: Their horses were seven hundred and thirty-six, their mules two hundred and forty-five
Bahnar: Lu sư đei tơpơh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơdrâu tŏ aseh 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm aseh la.

English: their camels four hundred and thirty-five, and donkeys six thousand seven hundred and twenty.
Bahnar: Puăn-hrĕng pêng-jĭt pơđăm lăk-đa păng tơdrâu-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt aseh lai.

English: And some of the heads of the fathers’ houses gave to the work. The governor gave to the treasury one thousand gold drachmas, fifty basins, and five hundred and thirty priestly garments.
Bahnar: Đei lu kră kơdră wei-lăng adrĕch adrung chĕp ba tơmam pơyơ̆r tơgŭm tơdrong jang. Kră pơgơ̆r pơyơ̆r 'măn lê̆ tơ lăm hnam mong tơmam minh-rơbâu Đarik maih, pơđăm-jĭt hlak kơthao păng pơđăm-hrĕng pêng-jĭt blah ao 'bok soi.

English: Some of the heads of the fathers’ houses gave to the treasury of the work twenty thousand gold drachmas, and two thousand two hundred silver minas.
Bahnar: Đei lu kơdră lu adrĕch adrung pơyơ̆r, tơ lăm hnam mong tơmam, 'bar-jĭt rơbâu Đarik Maih.

English: And that which the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand gold drachmas, two thousand silver minas, and sixty-seven priestly garments.
Bahnar: Păng 'bar-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng mina hu păng tơdrâu-jĭt tơpơh blah ao 'bok soi.

English: So the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, some of the people, the Nethinim, and all Israel dwelt in their cities. When the seventh month came, the children of Israel were in their cities.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu 'bok soi, bơngai Lêwi, lu bơngai gak 'măng jang, lu bơngai hơri, lu kon pơlei păng bơngai đĭch đam kră hnam yang kư̆m đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael, oei lăm pơlei sư kơdih. Truh tơ khei tơpơh, na kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng rim pơlei wih brŏk akŭm tơ pơlei sư kơdih Jêrusalem.

English: Now all the people gathered together as one man in the open square that was in front of the Water Gate; and they told Ezra the scribe to bring the Book of the Law of Moses, which the LORD had commanded Israel.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơgơ̆p akŭm băl jing thoi minh 'nu bơngai, tơ lăm pơlei tih 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng jang Đak lu sư pơma hăm Esơra thây bơtho, apinh sư chĕp sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt Môis mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang đei bơtho ăn kơ Isơrael.

English: So Ezra the priest brought the Law before the assembly of men and women and all who could hear with understanding on the first day of the seventh month.
Bahnar: Năr mă mônh khei tơpơh, Esơra 'bok soi chĕp ba sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt truh 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei, drŏ-nglo păng drŏ-kăn hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mơ̆ng păng hlôh.

English: Then he read from it in the open square that was in front of the Water Gate from morning until midday, before the men and women and those who could understand; and the ears of all the people were attentive to the Book of the Law.
Bahnar: Sư dơ̆ng tơ kơphô̆ 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng jang Đak, đŏk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar ei đơ̆ng pơgê hrôih truh tơ 'năr dơ̆ng, đei lu drŏ-nglo păng drŏ-kăn hăm đĭ lu bơngai mơ̆ng gơh hlôh. Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla mơ̆ng đŏk sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt.

English: So Ezra the scribe stood on a platform of wood which they had made for the purpose; and beside him, at his right hand, stood Mattithiah, Shema, Anaiah, Urijah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah; and at his left hand Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hashbadana, Zechariah, and Meshullam.
Bahnar: Thây bơtho khôi juăt Esơra dơ̆ng tơ kơpal hơdrơ̆l đe pơm păng 'long; kơplah noh Matithia, Sêma, Anaia, Uri, Hilkia păng Masêia, dơ̆ng gah 'ma sư; gah 'ngiĕo sư đei Pêđaia, Misael, Malkija, Hasum, Hasbađana, Sachari păng Mêsulam.

English: And Ezra opened the book in the sight of all the people, for he was standing above all the people; and when he opened it, all the people stood up.
Bahnar: Esơra pơih sơ̆p hla bơar 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei; sư dơ̆ng tơ anih kơjung hloh kơplah sư pơih sơ̆p hla bơar, na kon pơlei iung dang dơ̆ng đĭ.

English: And Ezra blessed the LORD, the great God. Then all the people answered, “Amen, Amen!” while lifting up their hands. And they bowed their heads and worshiped the LORD with their faces to the ground.
Bahnar: Esơra bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh, na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei yơ̆r ti na tơl khan A-men; A-men! Đơ̆ng noh kŭp kơ̆l drap muh măt tơ teh kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Also Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodijah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah, and the Levites, helped the people to understand the Law; and the people stood in their place.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei Jêsua, Bani, Sêrêbia, Jamin, Akup, Sabêthai, Hôđia, Masêja, Kêlita, Asaria, Jôsabat, Hanan, Pêlaia păng bơngai Lêwi, kư̆m tơblang ăn kơ kon pơlei hlôh khôi juăt; păng lu kon pơlei dơ̆ng kơtă anih lu sư.

English: So they read distinctly from the book, in the Law of God; and they gave the sense, and helped them to understand the reading.
Bahnar: Sư đŏk hơđăl lăm sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, đơ̆ng noh tơblang, tơgŭm bơngai mơ̆ng gơh hlôh nơ̆r sư đŏk.

English: And Nehemiah, who was the governor, Ezra the priest and scribe, and the Levites who taught the people said to all the people, “This day is holy to the LORD your God; do not mourn nor weep.” For all the people wept, when they heard the words of the Law.
Bahnar: Nêhêmi kră pơgơ̆r, Esơra 'bok soi păng pơm thây bơtho khôi juăt, lu bơngai Lêwi mă bơtho kon pơlei, kư̆m pơma khan kơ đĭ-đăng Isơrael thoi âu! 'Năr 'nâu jơ̆ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm; 'nĕ kơ sơ'ngon, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ nhơ̆m hmoi, yua kơ kon pơlei nhơ̆m kơplah lu sư kơtơ̆ng đŏk dôm lu nơ̆r khôi juăt.

English: Then he said to them, “Go your way, eat the fat, drink the sweet, and send portions to those for whom nothing is prepared; for this day is holy to our Lord. Do not sorrow, for the joy of the LORD is your strength.”
Bahnar: Nêhêmi pơma khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: Năm sa bĕ tơmam kiơ bek, huch nhă bĕ sik hơmu 'ngam păng tơgŭm lu bơngai ưh kơ đei hơmet sa tơmam kiơ; yua kơ 'năr 'nâu jơ̆ năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, 'măn kơ Kră Yang lu bơ̆n. 'Nĕ kơ sơ'ngon, yua kơ tơdrong hiôk chơt đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm pran.

English: So the Levites quieted all the people, saying, “Be still, for the day is holy; do not be grieved.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơngai Lêwi tơgŭm kon pơlei gơh hiôk hơđơ̆ng, khan: Oei hreh bĕ, yua kơ 'năr 'nâu jơ̆ năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, 'nĕ kơ sơ'ngon.

English: And all the people went their way to eat and drink, to send portions and rejoice greatly, because they understood the words that were declared to them.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei năm sŏng sa păng huch nhă păng tơgŭm ăn tơmam sa pơm tơdrong hiôk chơt tih; yua kơ lu sư đei hlôh 'bôh nhen dôm lu nơ̆r đei bơtho boih kơ lu sư.

English: Now on the second day the heads of the fathers’ houses of all the people, with the priests and Levites, were gathered to Ezra the scribe, in order to understand the words of the Law.
Bahnar: Hlôi kơ năr mă 'bar, lu kră kơdră lăm hnam 'bă kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, năm akŭm tơ Esơra, bơngai bơtho khôi juăt năm mơ̆ng wă pơhrăm iŏk dôm lu nơ̆r lăm khôi juăt.

English: And they found written in the Law, which the LORD had commanded by Moses, that the children of Israel should dwell in booths during the feast of the seventh month
Bahnar: Lu sư đei 'bôh chih lăm khôi juăt; Kră Yang tơtă kơ Môis khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael athei oei lăm hnam bơsŭn kơplah pơm giĕng et sa lăm khei tơpơh

English: and that they should announce and proclaim in all their cities and in Jerusalem, saying, “Go out to the mountain, and bring olive branches, branches of oil trees, myrtle branches, palm branches, and branches of leafy trees, to make booths, as it is written.”
Bahnar: păng wă kơ lu sư athei năm ră roi lăm rim pơlei păng tơ Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng: Năm bĕ tơ pơlei groi kông gơ̆ ba lu dơng 'long ôliwơ păng 'long ôliwơ bri, lu dơng 'long gơsing păng lu dơng 'long roh, đei hơmŭl hla lơ wă pơm bơsŭn, thoi đei chih boih.

English: Then the people went out and brought them and made themselves booths, each one on the roof of his house, or in their courtyards or the courts of the house of God, and in the open square of the Water Gate and in the open square of the Gate of Ephraim.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei năm na brŏk chĕp ba lu hla ei, rim 'nu pơm bơsŭn lu sư pơyơ̆l kơpal bơbŭng bơsŭn lu sư păng tơ cham lu sư kơdih, tơ lăm cham kơdeng hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơ anih cham 'măng jang Đak păng tơ cham să 'măng jang Êphraim.

English: So the whole assembly of those who had returned from the captivity made booths and sat under the booths; for since the days of Joshua the son of Nun until that day the children of Israel had not done so. And there was very great gladness.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei khŭl akŭm lu bơngai đơ̆ng pơm bơnă gơh wih brŏk pơm bơsŭn păng oei tơ noh. Yua kơ đơ̆ng chăl Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, truh tơ năr noh, kon pơlei Isơrael tam mă biơh pơm et sa tih thoi noh, đei tơdrong hiôk chơt tih dêh.

English: Also day by day, from the first day until the last day, he read from the Book of the Law of God. And they kept the feast seven days; and on the eighth day there was a sacred assembly, according to the prescribed manner.
Bahnar: Rim năr, đơ̆ng năr blŭng-a truh tơ năr tuch-luch, sư đŏk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư pơm giĕng sŏng sa lăm tơpơh năr; truh năr mă tơhngam đei akŭm pơm giĕng tih, pơm kiơ̆ thoi đei tơtă boih.

English: Now on the twenty-fourth day of this month the children of Israel were assembled with fasting, in sackcloth, and with dust on their heads.
Bahnar: Năr 'bar-jĭt puăn lăm khei noh, kon pơlei Isơrael akŭm ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa asu 'bi păng pung 'mui teh tơ kơ̆l lu sư.

English: Then those of Israelite lineage separated themselves from all foreigners; and they stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their fathers.
Bahnar: Adrĕch Isơrael tơklah đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơmoi, iung tơbral tơdrong yoch kơdih păng tơdrong kơnê̆ đơ̆ng 'bok lu sư.

English: And they stood up in their place and read from the Book of the Law of the LORD their God for one–fourth of the day; and for another fourth they confessed and worshiped the LORD their God.
Bahnar: Lu sư iung dơ̆ng kơtă anih, đŏk lăm sơ̆p hla bơar khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kơdih đunh dang minh lăm puăn lăm năr noh, minh lăm puăn dơ̆ng, lu sư tơbral tơdrong yoch păng kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: Then Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani stood on the stairs of the Levites and cried out with a loud voice to the LORD their God.
Bahnar: Jêsua, Bani, Katmiêh, Sêbania, Buni, Sêrêbia, Bani păng Kênani, iung dơ̆ng tơ kơpal hơdrơ̆l bơngai Lêwi păng ôr 'bơ̆r re krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư kơdih.

English: And the Levites, Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabniah, Sherebiah, Hodijah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah, said: “Stand up and bless the LORD your God Forever and ever! “Blessed be Your glorious name, Which is exalted above all blessing and praise!
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai Lêwi, Jêsua, Katmiêh, Bani, Hasapneia, Sêrêbia, Hôđia, Sêbania păng Pêtahia khan: Iung bơnê ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Kră Yang đei ling-lang dang ei dĭng truh tơ ning-mônh. Trŏ kơkuh bơnê Anăn 'lơ̆ng rŏ Sư, kơjung hloh kơ tơdrong kơkuh păng nơ̆r bơnê.

English: You alone are the LORD; You have made heaven, The heaven of heavens, with all their host, The earth and everything on it, The seas and all that is in them, And You preserve them all. The host of heaven worships You.
Bahnar: Ơi! Minh 'nu Kră Yang đĕch, ưh kơ đei 'bar nai. Ih boih Kră Yang pơjing kơ lu tăl plĕnh păng lu hơtăl plĕnh hăm lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh, kơtuăl teh păng lu tơmam kơpal teh, đak dơsĭ păng dôm lu kon sem brem lăm noh; Ih wei rong lu tơmam noh păng dôm lu linh kơpal plĕnh kư̆m kơkuh, pơyom kơ Ih.

English: “You are the LORD God, Who chose Abram, And brought him out of Ur of the Chaldeans, And gave him the name Abraham
Bahnar: Ơ! Kră Yang Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă đei rơih iŏk Abram, chông sư lĕch đơ̆ng Ur kon pơlei Kalđê păng krao anăn sư Abraham.

English: You found his heart faithful before You, And made a covenant with him To give the land of the Canaanites, The Hittites, the Amorites, The Perizzites, the Jebusites, And the Girgashites— To give it to his descendants. You have performed Your words, For You are righteous.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'bôh boih jơhngơ̆m sư tơpăt tơnăp 'bơ̆t anăp Ih păng Ih pơgơ̆p hăm sư, ăn kơ adrĕch adrung sư char đe Kanaan, kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Amôrit, kon pơlei Phêrêsit, kon pơlei Jêbus păng kon pơlei Girgasit păng pơsĭt 'blep trŏ boih thoi nơ̆r Ih pơkă, yua kơ Ih tơpăt hơnơ̆ng.

English: “You saw the affliction of our fathers in Egypt, And heard their cry by the Red Sea.
Bahnar: Ih 'bôh boih tơdrong pơmat-tat lu 'bok nhôn lăm dêh Êyiptơ, đei kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r lu sư krao ôr 'bơ̆t đak dơsĭ 'brê.

English: You showed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, Against all his servants, And against all the people of his land. For You knew that they acted proudly against them. So You made a name for Yourself, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Pơm boih tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch păng tơdrong hlĭch chrơp wă blah Pharaôn, hăm lu đĭch đam sư păng kon pơlei pơla lăm teh đak sư; yua kơ Ih băt: Lu sư pơgŏ pơjuă pơđep 'bok lu nhôn kơnê̆ dêh, đe oei ang truh tơ dang ei.

English: And You divided the sea before them, So that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; And their persecutors You threw into the deep, As a stone into the mighty waters.
Bahnar: Ih tơklah lê̆ đak dơsĭ 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư. Lu sư yak tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ hlôi thoi nơnăm kơpal teh hrĕng kro, bĕ lu bơngai druh, Ih klơ̆m lê̆ lu sư tơ sơlŭng jrŭ, nhen thoi klơ̆m tơmo lăm đak tih.

English: Moreover You led them by day with a cloudy pillar, And by night with a pillar of fire, To give them light on the road Which they should travel.
Bahnar: Kơ'năr Ih yua hơmơ̆l chông anhăk lu sư păng kơmăng Ih yua jrăng ŭnh, wă pơchrang hơdah kơ lu sư yak năm rok trong.

English: “You came down also on Mount Sinai, And spoke with them from heaven, And gave them just ordinances and true laws, Good statutes and commandments.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m jur tơ kơpal kông Sinai, pơma hăm lu sư đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh, tơjur ăn kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong trŏ, khôi juăt tơpăt 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong tơtă sĭt.

English: You made known to them Your holy Sabbath, And commanded them precepts, statutes and laws, By the hand of Moses Your servant.
Bahnar: Ih tơbăt kơ lu sư năr Sa'bat năr 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đơ̆ng Ih, yua Môis đĭch đam Ih, bơtho kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong tơtă tơdrong rơgoh 'lơ̆ng păng khôi juăt.

English: You gave them bread from heaven for their hunger, And brought them water out of the rock for their thirst, And told them to go in to possess the land Which You had sworn to give them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh Ih tơjur ăn 'bĕng sa wă huay kơ pơngot, pơm kơ tơmo đei đak lĕch ro ăn kơ lu sư nhă, pơkă kơ lu sư mơ̆t iŏk asong dêh char mă Ih wă ăn kơ lu sư.

English: “But they and our fathers acted proudly, Hardened their necks, And did not heed Your commandments.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok lu nhôn pơang arăng kơ̆l, ưh kơ mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong Ih tơtă.

English: They refused to obey, And they were not mindful of Your wonders That You did among them. But they hardened their necks, And in their rebellion They appointed a leader To return to their bondage. But You are God, Ready to pardon, Gracious and merciful, Slow to anger, Abundant in kindness, And did not forsake them.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ păng ưh kơ 'blŏk dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Ih đei pơm boih tŏk-bŏk lu sư; mă-lei lu sư arăng kơ̆l, lăm tơdrong lu sư pơm kơchu rơih chă minh 'nu bơngai pơm yŏng wă chông hơlơ̆k brŏk tơ dêh char Êyiptơ dơ̆ng mă đêl lu sư pơm đĭch. Mă-lei Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ yo băt kơ 'mêm mơnat, hiơ̆ kơ hil păng 'bĕnh hăm tơdrong 'mêm mơnat, Ih ưh kơ achăng lê̆ lu sư ôh.

English: “Even when they made a molded calf for themselves, And said, ‘This is your god That brought you up out of Egypt,’ And worked great provocations
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư man minh pôm rup kon rơmo na khan: 'Nâu boih yang mă chông anhăk lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ păng tơblĕk Ih dêh tơpă.

English: Yet in Your manifold mercies You did not forsake them in the wilderness. The pillar of the cloud did not depart from them by day, To lead them on the road; Nor the pillar of fire by night, To show them light, And the way they should go.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih yua tơdrong Ih 'mêm, ưh kơ đei achăng lê̆ lu sư lăm char glă, jrăng hơmơ̆l chông anhăk rok trong kơ'năr, ưh kơ weh đơ̆ng lu sư ôh, kơmăng jrăng ŭnh pơchrang hơdah păng tơ'bôh trong kơ lu sư yak kiơ̆.

English: You also gave Your good Spirit to instruct them, And did not withhold Your manna from their mouth, And gave them water for their thirst.
Bahnar: Ih ăn boih kơ lu sư yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih wă bơtho tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư, kư̆m ưh kơ sơngah mana kơ 'bơ̆r lu sư sa păng đak nhă kơ lu sư rơhing.

English: Forty years You sustained them in the wilderness; They lacked nothing; Their clothes did not wear out And their feet did not swell.
Bahnar: Tơpă, Ih wei rong lu sư puăn-jĭt sơnăm lăm char glă; lu sư huay kơ lah kiơ ôh; hơbĕn ao lu sư kư̆m huay kơ so hiah păng jơ̆ng lu sư kư̆m huay kơ pơ'ngeh.

English: “Moreover You gave them kingdoms and nations, And divided them into districts. So they took possession of the land of Sihon, The land of the king of Heshbon, And the land of Og king of Bashan.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Ih kư̆m ăn kơ lu sư đei teh đak păng lu kon pơlei pơla, Ih klah asong kơ lu sư teh đak oei, lu sư iŏk đơ̆ng teh đak Sihôn pơtao pơlei Hesbôn păng đơ̆ng teh đak Ok pơtao char Basan.

English: You also multiplied their children as the stars of heaven, And brought them into the land Which You had told their fathers To go in and possess.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m thim ăn đei kon sâu hrôh ngôh lơ thoi lu sơnglŏng tơ kơpal plĕnh, ba lu sư mơ̆t tơ dêh mă Ih đei pơkă hăm 'bok lu sư sơ̆: Lu iĕm gô mơ̆t tơ noh na iŏk asong băl dêh noh.

English: So the people went in And possessed the land; You subdued before them the inhabitants of the land, The Canaanites, And gave them into their hands, With their kings And the people of the land, That they might do with them as they wished.
Bahnar: Thoi noh kon sâu lu sư mơ̆t păng iŏk dêh char, Ih pơlung lu kon pơlei dêh Kanaan, pơjao kon pơlei noh păng lu pơtao dêh noh hăm lu kon pơlei lăm tơpang ti lu sư pơgơ̆r mơ̆ng kơ lu sư wă.

English: And they took strong cities and a rich land, And possessed houses full of all goods, Cisterns already dug, vineyards, olive groves, And fruit trees in abundance. So they ate and were filled and grew fat, And delighted themselves in Your great goodness.
Bahnar: Lu sư blah tơgar iŏk pơlei tih kơjăp păng chŭn mir teh 'lơ̆ng, lu hnam 'bĕnh kơ tơmam 'lơ̆ng, lu đak sơlŭng, pơgar hơmu, pơgar ôliwơ păng plei 'long lơ; lu sư sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai păng bek, hiôk chơt lăm tơdrong 'mêm Kră Yang tih dêh.

English: “Nevertheless they were disobedient And rebelled against You, Cast Your law behind their backs And killed Your prophets, who testified against them To turn them to Yourself; And they worked great provocations.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, lu sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r păng sơngah kơ Ih, hŭt lê̆ khôi juăt Ih tơ rŏng păng pơlôch lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol Ih wă chông ba lu sư brŏk tơ Ih; mă-lei lu sư tơblĕk Ih rai dêh.

English: Therefore You delivered them into the hand of their enemies, Who oppressed them; And in the time of their trouble, When they cried to You, You heard from heaven; And according to Your abundant mercies You gave them deliverers who saved them From the hand of their enemies.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh Ih jao boih lu sư lăm tơpang ti đe ayăt kơ lu sư; lu đe pơmat pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư, lăm lu sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat lu sư ôr krao chă Ih păng Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng lu sư; jơhngơ̆m 'mêm Ih tih dêh, Ih yua lu bơngai nuih pran kơtang dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư.

English: “But after they had rest, They again did evil before You. Therefore You left them in the hand of their enemies, So that they had dominion over them; Yet when they returned and cried out to You, You heard from heaven; And many times You delivered them according to Your mercies
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu sư hiôk-hian, wơ̆t pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Ih; yua kơ thoi noh Ih achăng lê̆ jao lu sư lăm tơpang ti lu đe ayăt wei-lăng pơgơ̆r lu sư. Mă-lei lu sư ôr krao Ih dơ̆ng, na Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng lu sư, kiơ̆ thoi Ih 'mêm, đơ̆ng noh dŏng pơklaih lu sư đei lơ 'măng, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong 'mêm Ih tih dêh.

English: And testified against them, That You might bring them back to Your law. Yet they acted proudly, And did not heed Your commandments, But sinned against Your judgments, ‘Which if a man does, he shall live by them.’ And they shrugged their shoulders, Stiffened their necks, And would not hear.
Bahnar: Ih pơma chrih kơ lu sư, wă kơ chông lu sư wih brŏk dơ̆ng tơ khôi juăt Ih lei ră lu sư kư̆ pơang kuă kơ mơ̆ng dôm lu khôi juăt Ih, pơm glăi kơ tơdrong juăt Ih. Tơdrong juăt mă tơdah bơngai bu chu pơm kiơ̆ gơh đei tơdrong arih; lu sư arăng kơ̆l wih rŏng ưh kơ wă pơm kiơ̆.

English: Yet for many years You had patience with them, And testified against them by Your Spirit in Your prophets. Yet they would not listen; Therefore You gave them into the hand of the peoples of the lands.
Bahnar: Ih mơnat kơ lu sư lơ sơnăm, yua Yang bơhngol 'lơ̆ng păng lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol pơm kơdranh kơ lu sư, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă pơgling đon mơ̆ng, thoi noh Ih pơjao lu sư lăm tơpang ti lu kon pơlei lăm char noh.

English: Nevertheless in Your great mercy You did not utterly consume them nor forsake them; For You are God, gracious and merciful.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih đei jơhngơ̆m 'mêm tih dêh, Ih ưh kơ đei pơlôch pơrăm lu sư, kư̆m ưh kơ đei achăng lê̆ lu sư, yua kơ Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat păng pơm 'lơ̆ng.

English: “Now therefore, our God, The great, the mighty, and awesome God, Who keeps covenant and mercy: Do not let all the trouble seem small before You That has come upon us, Our kings and our princes, Our priests and our prophets, Our fathers and on all Your people, From the days of the kings of Assyria until this day.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na dang ei. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tih hloh mơsêh mơyang trŏ kơ hli yom, bơwei tơdrong pơgơ̆p păng tơdrong pơm 'lơ̆ng, 'nĕ lăng tơdrong âu thoi iĕ đĕch 'bơ̆t anăp Ih dôm lu tơdrong jĭ jăn pơmat-tat đei truh boih kơ lu nhôn, tơ lu pơtao păng lu kră pơgơ̆r, tơ lu 'bok soi păng lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, kơ 'bok yă lu nhôn păng tơ kon pơlei Kră Yang, đơ̆ng chăl lu pơtao Asiri truh tơ dang ei.

English: However You are just in all that has befallen us; For You have dealt faithfully, But we have done wickedly.
Bahnar: Lăm dôm tơdrong truh kơ lu nhôn, Ih oei tơpăt hơnơ̆ng đĕch; yua kơ Ih pơm trŏ tơpă, gah lu nhôn pơm tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Neither our kings nor our princes, Our priests nor our fathers, Have kept Your law, Nor heeded Your commandments and Your testimonies, With which You testified against them.
Bahnar: Lu pơtao nhôn lu kră pơgơ̆r, lu 'bok soi păng lu 'bok nhôn, ưh kơ bơwei khôi juăt Ih, kư̆m ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Ih tơtă păng tơbăt, Ih phak bơtho lu nhôn.

English: For they have not served You in their kingdom, Or in the many good things that You gave them, Or in the large and rich land which You set before them; Nor did they turn from their wicked works.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm dêh sư oei pŭn hiôk rơkah rơkai đơ̆ng Ih ăn, teh rơhơi să păng jing 'lơ̆ng Ih asong ăn, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă kơkuh kơ Ih, ưh kơ weh ôh đơ̆ng tơdrong jang kơnê̆ lu sư.

English: “Here we are, servants today! And the land that You gave to our fathers, To eat its fruit and its bounty, Here we are, servants in it!
Bahnar: Na dang ei lu nhôn pơm đĭch; 'nâu lu nhôn jing đĭch lăm dêh char mă Ih ăn kơ lu 'bok nhôn, phĕ sa plei păng tơmam lĕch đơ̆ng noh.

English: And it yields much increase to the kings You have set over us, Because of our sins; Also they have dominion over our bodies and our cattle At their pleasure; And we are in great distress.
Bahnar: Tơmam plei sa lĕch đơ̆ng teh đak âu rơkah rơkai Ih ăn kơ lu pơtao pơgơ̆r nhôn, yua kơ lu nhôn pơm tơdrong yoch, lu pơtao noh mơ̆ng kơ sư wă pơm kiơ kơ akâu jăn lu nhôn păng sem dơrong lu nhôn păng dang ei pơm kơ lu nhôn oei pơmat-tat dêh.

English: “And because of all this, We make a sure covenant and write it; Our leaders, our Levites, and our priests seal it.”
